content: “ Also, if you don’t like reading, that doesn’t make you dumb. It just means that you don’t like reading, because reading actually is a morally neutral act. I believe this”- OH SO TRUE. My version of this is hiking and camping. My deal breaker is people who act like I said I like to stab puppies when I reveal that I don’t enjoy camping or hiking that much. I think there’s something absurd about packing a simulacrum of a house in a backpack, carrying it out to a smooth place in the dirt, recreating a tiny fragile house that’s less comfortable than an actual house and being like “AHHHHH this is the best way to spend my free time! No one else knows pure joy or simplicity like I do.” while freezing in the back and roasting in the front and shivering and pretending like you are reading that copy of walden you brought with you…not listening for bears. And for the record I love to stay in cabins and I’ll walk a very long distance if there’s points of interest and i have camped a lot, my disinterest comes from intimate knowledge. Camping and people’s superiority…ugh. I’m not trying to stop anyone from camping at all, go ahead, but I don’t personally care for it, and I’m still a very nice human.
